title: Lead Software Engineer, Mobile
description: HealthLeap is looking for a founding Lead Software Engineer skilled in React Native, preferably based in San Francisco, CA.Compensation: $120K - $200K, 3% - 5% equity (we're backed by a prominent deep tech VC). Benefits include medical, dental, vision, and 401(k) with matching.As a HealthLeap engineer, you will be building the next-generation tech to improve global health through better nutrition. Malnutrition in hospitals worsens health outcomes for nearly all sick patients and is associated with a 3-5x increase in mortality during a hospital stay. It affects 30-50% of patients, but only 5% are diagnosed. Our first product is a smart mobile assistant to help healthcare professionals better treat/prevent disease-related malnutrition.As a founding engineer, you will own the core app development work and become a leader in the engineering team as it grows. You and our CTO co-founder, will collaborate on a range of software development work, including the mobile app, integrations (e.g. EHR), data pipelines, and website.Our engineers love understanding how things work and have a strong drive to build technology that could improve the lives of millions. You will perform best in our team if you are product-focused, care about iterating on user feedback, have a high standard for quality software, and if you are deeply motivated to help improve healthcare.You are amazing at:Logic and solving puzzlesAcquiring new skills fastReact Native developmentMobile app architectureBuilding and integrating with REST and GraphQL APIsHaving an eye for good designApplying DevOps principles to your workflow, such as rapidly iteratingBonus:Experience in a US healthcare-focused startup (ideally worked on a HIPAA-compliant product)Skilled in both iOS and Android developmentYou’ve grown or led a startup engineering team beforeWorked on EHR integrationsExperience with AWS, specifically Amplify, DynamoDB, Cognito, AppSync, CloudFormationBack-end development skills in JS and PythonVue and Tailwind CSS experienceA health/bio/pharma nerdYou enjoy thinking about the creation of artificial general intelligenceFun facts about our co-founders:CTO: Ray started programming at age 9, deployed a public sector health and safety application when he was 13, read his dad’s postgraduate pharmacology textbooks for fun, co-founded a profitable crypto/AI startup (now worth $250M+) when he was 21.CEO: Josiah started launching profitable ventures when he was 13, initially to cover his flight to the International Maths Competition. He studied Mathematics and Applied Statistics and led the Product team at a Series A crypto startup.CRO: Jemima is a passionate clinical dietitian that hacked together the first version of a clinical productivity tool, which allowed her and her colleagues to treat more malnourished patients during hospital rotations.Please apply online with HealthLeap Inc. at: https://healthleap.rippling-ats.com/job/372600/lead-software-engineer-mobile?s=cl

title: Market Research Project Manager
description:
Evans Data Corp is the leading market research firmly focused exclusively on software development. We’ve been in business since 1998 and proudly serve the largest businesses in the software industry as well as many major investment firms and banks. Just as our client’s needs are cutting edge, so is the information we produce. We are currently looking for new team members to help us with this exciting mission.

As a Market Research Project Manager, you will manage market research projects focused on software development and provide insights. Meet with clients to determine and understand objectives, design questionnaires, create charts and tables from survey data, process data, analyze results within the context of the software development industry, report on and present results, and manage projects. Must be able to understand objectives of highly technical software clients, analyze data to address objectives and put together a coherent narrative explaining the implications of the results to the client. Must also have a firm grasp of the software industry, who the major players are and what the industry trends are.

This is a great opportunity for a bright, ambitious, and energetic individual who wants to develop a career in the high tech sector, but also wants to work in Santa Cruz in a friendly and relaxed environment. If you are knowledgeable about software development, developer programs, or new and emerging trends in the software industry, and have applicable skills, this position is right for you.

Qualified candidates should have all of the following:
•	Strong aptitude for numbers and creative analytical and problem solving skills
•	Familiarity with R and data analysis
•	Strong written and verbal communication skills
•	Well honed presentation skills with the ability to inspire confidence
•	Skilled in major Microsoft Office applications
•	Keen attention to detail and producer of high quality work
•	Knowledge of statistics and quantitative research methodologies
•	Passion for technology and a solid understanding of the major players in the industry today along with the major tech shifts that are shaping the industry
•	Client service experience is preferable
•	Knowledge of SPSS is a definite plus

Job is full-time,  in-office located in Santa Cruz.
compensation: Salary ranges vary depending on qualifications plus benefits

title: Software Engineer (R&D)
description:
Domino Data Lab, Inc. has multiple openings for multiple software engineering positions, including Software Engineers (R&D). 

Responsibilities: Design and build new products with a focus on innovation and pushing Domino’s data science platform to the edge. Build tooling for highly technical end users (code-first data scientists). Build software to support machine learning workflows. Research data science and machine learning best practices. Run internal data science projects using the team’s tools. Interview data scientists in the field to understand pain points and create solutions to the problems they face. Develop relationships with data scientists. Build enterprise software products, systems, and services that have immediate impact on our customers. Write durable, well-tested code with an unwavering commitment to product quality. Design, code, review, test, debug, document, and maintain programs. Participate in the entire software development lifecycle. Design and develop the specifications and architecture of our software products based on specific client needs and capabilities. Provide post-implementation technical support, including monitoring application performance and debugging existing code. Collaborate with product managers to drive the technical direction and architectural decisions needed to build and scale our product. Other duties as assigned. 

Education: Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field.

Requirements: Experience in the job offered or related position. Other special requirements include: Experience in software engineering in the data science/modeling context; Experience with statistical modeling and machine learning model development; Experience with the following programming languages: Python or R; Java or C#; Experience with system architecture including MVC and API-based application design patterns; and Experience with DevOps, maintaining CI/CD pipelines and automated code-quality checks.

*Experience in special requirements can be gained through academic coursework or professional experience. 

Fax resumes to Domino Data Lab, Inc. attn: Kelli Ingraham at 1-650-266-0552, noting position and job order #SRD03.

title: GNC (Guidance Navigation Controls) Engineer $72/hr
description:
Boundary Layer Technologies is building the future of zero emission maritime transport, starting with hydrofoiling electric passenger vessels. We are backed by Y Combinator, Fifty Years VC and Lower Carbon Capital and have built a world leading 26' fully electric hydrofoil prototype. We are a company of builders where rapid iterations and fast learning is in our DNA. We aim to reduce global GHG emissions by as much as 2.5%
Website:
Boundarylayer.tech


We are looking for a guidance, navigation and controls engineer to own development and testing of the GNC systems on our hydrofoiling craft. 

Responsibilities
Design and implementation of flight control system for electric hydrofoil vehicles. 
Provide analysis and guidance to other teams on flight dynamics, vehicle loads, actuator loads and sizing. 
Develop a sensor suite and develop the filtering and state estimation algorithms  Improve existing and develop the GNC workflow - simulations, hardware-in-the loop testing, integration, flight test, and post analysis for continual and efficient improvement. 
Improve our existing flight control software, sensors and state estimation on prototype hydrofoil craft Pamplemousse. 
Analysis of flight data and written and verbal communication of results Support testing activities 
Skills and experience
Experience in GNC including student project teams (rocket club, FSAE, solar cars, or projects) or personal projects
Degree in engineering or physics
Familiarity of Matlab and Simulink
Familiarity with fixed wing vehicle physics
Familiarity with sensors, avionics, and state estimation 
Benefits of this role
Work towards building a better, zero carbon world
Enjoy super rapid development, testing, and deployment (it's really hard to crash a boat!)
Work in an incredibly lightly regulated sector (no FAA rules for boats!)
Bring cutting edge innovation into an often overlooked yet massive and critical industry
Market competitive salary and equity package
Healthcare, dental, and optical insurance
12 weeks paid parental leave
Dog friendly office
Work closely with CEO and CTO
Choose your own hardware budget
4 weeks PTO
Access to company boats for employee recreational use

title: Code Coaches/Tutors Needed In Person, College/ HS AP ok (South Bay)
description:
Who We Are
theCoderSchool is the #1 after-school coding program in Silicon Valley. The future will be ever more dependent on technology so let's get our young generation ready. Learn to Code, Change the World. 

http://southbay.thecoderschool.com/

Job Summary
theCoderSchool is looking for passionate Code Coaches to teach our next generation how to change the world! You will meet incredible kids, teach them how to code (and how to think like a coder!), and be rewarded with an amazing experience. This is a part-time position for 2-30 hours/week (same times weekly), depending on your schedule. Our open hours will be generally 3:30-7:30pm on select weekdays and Saturdays from 10am-4pm. If you have availability in other hours, please let us know. We will provide Instructor Training, and will use more of a "teaching methodology" than a curriculum. Much of our teaching will be reverse-engineering games or concepts, and will adapt to a particular student's interests and skills. We are hiring immediately for both In-Person and Remote Coaches.

Responsibilities
A Code Coach is a mentor who teaches kids how to code. At theCoderSchool, we have two basic teaching styles - your assignment will depend on schedule, ability, and desire. 
1. Private and Semi-Private Tutoring. One-to-one or one-to-few coding lessons for kids. Typically in Scratch/Snap for the younger kids and Javascript/HTML, Python and Game Dev for older kids. Specialty programming like Unity/C#, Swift, or Roblox/Minecraft is a huge plus! 
2. Group Code Class. Inspire students who are new to code with instructor-led projects. Work with a more set-curriculum for drag-and-drop languages that you'll teach in a classroom style using the "Scratch" environment that was developed by MIT.

This position rocks because you will:
* Meet, mentor, and grow amazing kids who are ready to learn, and potentially manage a team of kids to create an application.
* Meet and communicate with parents - many of whom will be techies themselves, who work at some of the best companies and startups in Silicon Valley.
* Give back to the community and help grow our next generation by sharing your knowledge of technology

Requirements
What do we want from you? Read on.
* PASSION. All caps! You ooze excitement for technology; you can't wait to play with the latest 3D gaming platform. Your students must be inspired by your energy and enthusiasm :)
* Great Communicator. There will be plenty of chatting with parents, and of course it's often necessary to explain concepts in a few different ways!
* Kid at heart. Our best coaches understand what gets kids excited because they love the same things: gamers please apply!
* Coding Skills. Strong grasp of basic procedural programming. General knowledge of one or more languages is assumed - Javascript, HTML/CSS, Python, C#, Java, and C++ are most helpful. Deep technical skills aren't necessarily required - we prefer you communicate and empathize well with your students. 
* Big bonus for game development and app development: Unity, LUA, Roblox, Swift, Minecraft, etc
* Experience teaching kids is a plus
* College and high school students with an AP Computer Science (Java) background encouraged to apply
* U.S. Citizens or Permanent Green-Card only; clean criminal background check required (no Felony, Misdemeanor or DUI convictions)

Interested? Send us an email with a cover letter and resume. Let's do this!

https://www.paycomonline.net/v4/ats/web.php/jobs/ViewJobDetails?job=48753&clientkey=8BDFD7E87A5FC091B4425C5059588D42

Position overview: The position of Calibration Technician reports to the Cal Lab Lead and is responsible for performing the testing of electronic devices and calibration

Key Responsibilities

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Perform standard testing and calibration process on any Sierra Instruments manufactured product
Prepare and inspect devices for calibration
Maintain documentation for work orders
Set-up flow stations for testing and calibrations
Record results per calibration procedure
Perform routine maintenance on equipment
Position Requirements

Competent at PCB testing using programming equipment
Must be able to follow ESD safety practices
Knowledge of industry specific tests and testing equipment
Knowledge of concepts, practices, and procedures regarding flow measurement
Strong interpersonal, organization and time management skills
Must be able to lift 50 pounds
Able to work independently and work well with others
Good writing, documentation, and analytical skills
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with ISO/ATEX/LVD standards for CE marked products
Degree in science from an accredited university or 3 years work experience in said field
Traits:

Ability to uphold Sierra’s mission and vision. Must be accurate and attention to details. Willing to take on tasks as directed. Willing to take initiative when appropriate. Willing to be flexible as needed. Trustworthy, loyal, helpful, friendly, courteous, kind, cheerful, thrifty, and respectful.

Computer Skills:

Proficient in Microsoft Windows (7, 10) and Microsoft Office (365)

Working Conditions:

Physical Demand(s):  Can lift 50 lbs, sitting and stand for reasonable periods of time
Visual Demand(s): Ability to look at a computer monitor for reasonable periods of time
Hazard(s): Manufacturing environment.

***Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the company.

title: Autonomous Vehicle/Linux Technician | $34 per hour
description:
If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/823fdff2/apply?c=t


HireArt is helping an autonomous ride-hailing company find an Autonomous Vehicle/Linux Technician to help them develop their Level 5 autonomous vehicle for production.

In this role, you'll be among the first to perform testing on new software deployments, through a blend of in-vehicle and remote operation testing. You'll identify issues, bugs, and trends, and collaborate with the engineering team on failure analysis.

We're looking for someone with a technical background, such as experience with coding, QA, or troubleshooting and basic knowledge of Linux. A degree or training in any STEM field or previous experience in the autonomous vehicle, automotive, or aviation industry is a plus.

If you're interested in making a contribution to the future of autonomous technology, keep reading!

As an Autonomous Vehicle/Linux Technician, you will:



Operate and complete tests on the L5 autonomous vehicle platform.
Support the Software team in the execution of key software operation tasks.
Provide input to improve processes and safety.
Assist with documentation and metrics capture.
Provide accurate written and oral feedback to engineering teams.
Perform basic vehicle preventative maintenance checks, services, and repairs.
Provide logistical support for the movement and storage of vehicles and equipment.






If you're interested in applying for the role, you can check it out here:
https://www.hireart.com/jobs/823fdff2/apply?c=t


Requirements

Experience working in a Linux environment
Experience working with and troubleshooting complex technical systems
Strong attention to detail and analytical skills
Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
A proven track record of working with little supervision, solving problems, and meeting deadlines
Proactive mindset and the resourcefulness and composure to be able to handle the unexpected
Excellent driving history and no criminal history
A driver's license and means of transportation to and from test sites
Flexibility for day, night, and/or weekend work, with as much advance notice as possible
Previous experience in the autonomous vehicle, automotive, or aviation industry is a plus
Some coding/troubleshooting experience, degree in a technical discipline or a military background is a plus





Commitment:This is a full-time (40 hours per week), ongoing contract position staffed via HireArt. It is open to candidates local to Tracy, CA.

HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas or employ corp-to-corp.

https://www.hireart.com/jobs/823fdff2/apply?c=t

title: Accelerate your Front-End Engineering Career in Tech
description:
Are you working in Front End Engineering, and want to make more money?
Have you been looking for front end engineering jobs, but not making much progress?

Join Pathrise and level up your front end engineering job search for a high-paying career in tech today!

About Pathrise

Pathrise helps jobseekers get hired at top tech companies like Apple, Facebook, Google, Salesforce, and more.

We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, and The Atlantic, and we've even been called the "Y Combinator for your career."

In the past 3 years, we've helped more than 1000 people land amazing jobs at some of the best and highest-paying companies in America.

About the Fellowship

Pathrise fellows receive weekly 1-on-1 mentorship from Director and VP-level Front End Engineer leaders at companies like Google, IBM, and Linkedin.
You'll learn strategies to get the attention of any company, dial in your resume, ace your interviews, and more. We can even refer you directly to companies in our network.

By the end of the program, you'll have the skills and confidence to find a great job in software engineering that pays you what you're worth.

Qualifications

We're selective, and only work with motivated candidates who are serious about leveling up their careers.

But if you're interested in front end engineering jobs within the tech industry, there's no better program to help you find a well-compensated job at a great company.

To apply for the Pathrise program, go here:
https://www.pathrise.com/apply?utm_source=craigslist&utm_medium=job_board&utm_campaign=sac_swe_frontend

title: Information Technology Analyst - II - Placer County CDRA
description:
Information Technology Analyst - II
$41.52 - $51.86/hour; $7,196.80 - $8,989.07/month; $86,361.60 - $107,868.80/year

The Community Development Resource Agency (CDRA) seeking an individual to join the department’s Information Technology team. This position is responsible for working closely with end users, management, and IT staff to help implement technology solutions that streamline the land development process. 

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in business analysis and software implementation and will possess exceptional communication skills and an aptitude for understanding complex business processes. Candidates must demonstrate the ability to solve problems and complete tasks with minimal guidance.



Experience: Two years of professional level information technology experience comparable to Information Technology Analyst I with Placer County

Training: Equivalent to the completion of a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in computer science, information technology or a closely related field. Additional relevant technical experience that demonstrates the ability to perform analytical duties in assigned technology area may substitute for the required education on a year for year basis. Possession of one or more approved information technology certificates and/or completion of other approved technology-related training may substitute for some or all of the required education.



Placer County is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to an active nondiscrimination program.

To apply to this exciting career opportunity please visit our employment opportunities page at www.JobsAtPlacerCounty.com. 

All applications must be received by the final filing deadline as listed on our webpage.
